content:
This does not seem to be implemented in Backdrop... or did I do someting wrong? Has anyone used it sucessfully or has a workaround? https://www.webomelette.com/drupal-views-grouping-field-content-display-modes

The goal is to have a teaser list from an Event content ype, with multiple date values > one teaser per date.
@mazze.ch Interesting! Maybe a bug in Entity Reference?
Apart of that, your use case seems a bit different to the one in the linked article. There, a view is grouped by a single value date field, resulting in multiple teasers per date.
@Olaf Grabienski Yes I know, but will need the function in several different scenarios, including the grouping feature for the team page (grouping by department).
A workaround would be to use fields in your views. (I guess that's not what you're looking for, right?)

Oh, I just saw that https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/viewsnodefield is ported. That should do the trick!

backdrop-contrib/viewsnodefield
For that cool views plugin that just doesn't support node row display. - backdrop-contrib/viewsnodefield
From the description: "This module was created because some display plugins only work with fields (like grouping, for example)."
Yes, I already did solve it by using fields, it also works... this view basically shows two nodes with multi-date field https://lag.mazzemedia.ch/show
I already used the Views Nodefield module decades ago;-) but to be honest I do not remember what I used it for... I will check it, thank you @Olaf Grabienski
Great teamwork @Olaf Grabienski ++ @mazze.ch ++
